intro: Phlegmariurus reflexus, commonly known as the curled beard lichen, is a foliose lichen belonging to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, curled thallus that gives it a unique appearance. The plant typically grows on bark, stone, or soil in temperate regions, often in shaded environments. Its structure consists of a dense, leathery layer of symbiotic algae and fungi. The lichen is known for its ability to retain moisture and thrive in humid conditions.
